author: manunlp
content:
Either an EL bug, or either the exact same bug on LH, Teku and Prysm.

Do you know the commit corresponding to 
```
docker.ethquokkaops.io/dh/ethpandaops/geth:PeerDAS
```
?

(Would like to reproduce locally and it's easier for me to run get directly geth on my computer and not inside docker.)

author: parithosh
content:
it should be this PR: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/31097
so: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/commit/665c8512f388bd79053dce81b3920f65eb617289

i.e, just before geth merged in the `start osaka fork` PR

author: parithosh
content:
My current theory is that since we had one version of geth at the start of the chain and switched to this later - a fix PR might have been missing (we also moved from s1na's fork to geth master). 

We could:
1. debug this and backport the fix onto a peerDAS branch
2. just reset the devnet and start fresh, this time using the peerDAS branch all the way and never updating it till EL involvement is needed
happy to hear opinions, either approach works for me
